sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This document describes how ProActive Nodes are attributed to ProActive Virtual Nodes.

glossdef.para: A location to execute a computation. By default a Node is created for each CPU reported by a Java Runtime.

A set of Nodes. A Virtual Node is an abstraction for deploying parallel and distributed applications. Nodes are attached to Virtual Nodes by the Node Allocator. A set of Node Provider is attached to each Virtual Node. Only Nodes from theses Node Providers are elligible. If the set is empty then any Node can be attached to the Virtual Node.
The object in charge of Node attachment

A Node Provider acquires the resources described inside a GCM Deployment Descriptor and creates Node on them as described. When a Node is ready, the Node Provider send it to the ProActive Runtime who started the deployment. Each GCM Deployment Descriptor has its own Node Provider.
A Contract between a Node Provider and a Virtual Node on the amount of Node to be provided by the Node Provider to the Virtual Node.
The number of Nodes asked by a Virtual Node or a Node Provider
A Virtual Node or a Node Provider Contract is Greedy when not Capacity is defined. Such object will try to get as many Nodes as possible.
A Virtual Node is Ready when its capacity and all its Node Provider Contracts are satisfied.

sect1.title: XML Schema
sect1.para: The following XML Schema describes valid Virtual Node declarations. It is extracted from the GCM Application Descriptor schema.

para.code:
<complexType name="proactiveType"> <complexContent> <extension base="pa:applicationNodeType"> <sequence> <element name="virtualNode" type="pa:virtualNodeType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <unique name="nodeProviderConstraint"> <selector xpath="pa:nodeProvider"/> <field xpath="@refid"/> </unique> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="relpath" type="pa:pathElementGeneralType" use="optional"></attribute> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<complexType name="virtualNodeType"> <sequence> <element name="nodeProvider" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <complexType> <attribute name="refid" type="pa:idType"/> <attribute name="capacity" type="pa:capacityType" /> </complexType> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="id" type="string" use="required"/> <attribute name="capacity" type="pa:capacityType"/> </complexType>
<simpleType name="capacityType"> <restriction base="string"> <pattern value="([0-9]+)"></pattern> </restriction> </simpleType>

sect1.title: Node Allocator algorithms
sect1.para: This section describes algorithms used by the Node Allocator to attach Node to Virtual Nodes

The deployment mechanism CAN NOT ensure that a deployment will be able to fulfill GCM Application requirements (ex: If a Virtual Node wants 10 Nodes but the LAN described by a GCM Deployment Descriptor has only 8 Nodes). The deployment mechanism DOES NOT try to address this issue, it's up to the deployer the check that GCM Application Descriptor and GCM Deployment Descriptor are compatible. However, if a mapping exists the deployment mechanism MUST satisfy the requirements.

listitem.para: When a Node is created, it registers itself to the ProActive Runtime who started the deployment.
Then Node Allocator is notified of the Node arrival. It will attach the Node to a Virtual Node by using a 3 stages dispatching.
If the Node has not been attached in Stage 1 then it is sent to Stage 2
Stage 2 tries to satisfy capacity of Virtual Nodes.
A Node remains in Stage 2 until the condition is true.

This condition prevent a deadlock in the case of a non Greedy Virtual Node with both Greedy and non Greedy Node Provider Contracts. Greedy Node Provider Contracts have to be satisfied before allowing Node attached from Greedy Node Provider Contracts.
If the Node has not been attached in Stage 1 then it is sent to Stage 3
Stage 3 offers a Node to a Greedy Virtual Node

To ensure fairness in the Stage 3, a round robin if performed between Virtual Nodes. Every Virtual Node eligible at Stage 3 must receive the same amount of Stage 3 Nodes. Round robin is necessary only at Stage 3. Stage 1 and Stage 2 try to satisfy finite requirements.

sect1.title: Behavior specifications
sect1.para: This section describes the expected behavior of ProActive when parsing a given XML snippet. The behavior of any valid XML snippet can be inferred from the following sections. If you find a way to describe an undefined behavior please send me an email.

listitem.para: Greedy Virtual Node, no Capacity specified
Nodes from any Node Provider can be attached to it
Always Ready since Greedy and no requirements at Node Provider level
Asks for X Nodes
Nodes from any Node Provider can be attached to it
Is Ready when X Nodes are attached to it. If less than X Nodes were created by the deployment then it will never be Ready
vn1 and vn2 are Greedy Virtual Node
Nodes from any Node Provider can be attached to them
Always Ready since Greedy and no requirements at Node Provider level
Nodes are attached to vn1 and vn2 by using a round robin algorithm. vn1 and vn2 will get the same number of Nodes

sect2.title: Greedy Virtual Node with Greedy Node Provider Contract

listitem.para: Greedy Virtual Node, no Capacity specified
Only Nodes from NP1 can be attached to vn1
Always Ready since Greedy and the Node Provider Contract is Greedy too

sect2.title: Greedy Virtual Node with Node Provider

listitem.para: Greedy Virtual Node, no Capacity specified
Node Provider Contract between vn1 and NP1 with a Capacity of X
Only X Nodes from NP1 can be attached to vn1
Since only one Node Provider is listed, vn1 will not get more than X Nodes
Is Ready when X Nodes from NP1 are attached to it A Virtual Node is Ready when its Capacity requirement is fulfilled and all Node Provider Contracts are also satisfied

sect2.title: Virtual Node with a Greedy Node Provider Contract

listitem.para: vn1asks for X Nodes
Only Nodes from NP1 can be attached to vn1
Is Ready when X Nodes are attached to it.

sect2.title: Virtual Node with a Node Provider

listitem.para: vn1asks for X Nodes
Only Y Nodes from NP1 can be attached to vn1
Is Ready when X Nodes are attached to it and min(X, Y) node have been attached by NP1 If Y < X then the Virtual Node cannot be ready

sect2.title: Case
sect2.code: <virtualNode id="vn1" capacity="X"> <resourceProvider refid="NP1" capacity="Y"/> <resourceProvider refid="NP1" capacity="Z"/> </virtualNode>
sect2.para: Generalization of Use case 7 with X = Y + Z, X < Y + Z and X > Y + Z.
vn1 is Ready when X Nodes have been sent to it.

sect2.title: Virtual Node with several Greedy Node Providers

listitem.para: vn1 asks for X Nodes
Only Nodes from NP1 or NP2 can be attached to vn1
Is Ready when X Nodes are attached

sect2.title: Greedy Virtual Node with Greedy and non Greedy Node Providers
sect2.code: <virtualNode id="vn1"> <resourceProvider refid="1" capacity="Y" /> <resourceProvider refid="2" capacity="Z" /> <resourceProvider refid="3" /> </virtualNode>

listitem.para: Greedy Virtual Node, no Capacity specified
Only Nodes from NP1, NP2 or NP3 can be attached
Only Y Nodes from NP1 can be attached
Only Z Nodes from NP2 can be attached
Is Ready when Y Nodes from NP1 and Z Nodes from NP2 have been attached to it Since the Virtual Node is Greedy nodes from NP3 can be attached as soon as they arrive

sect2.title: Virtual Node with Greedy and non Greedy Node Providers
sect2.code: <virtualNode id="vn1" capacity="X"> <resourceProvider refid="1" capacity="Y" /> <resourceProvider refid="2" capacity="Z" /> <resourceProvider refid="3" /> </virtualNode>

listitem.para: vn1 asks for X Nodes
Only Nodes from NP1, NP2 or NP3 can be attached
Only Y Nodes from NP1 can be attached
Only Z Nodes from NP2 can be attached

Is Ready when X Nodes are attached and Y Nodes from NP1 and Z Nodes from NP2 have been attached to it Nodes from NP3 have to wait that NP1 and NP2 requirements are satisfied before to be attached to vn1

sect1.sect2:
Hierarchical Master/Worker
In this use case we have several Node Providers
